tr: a person with whom you are acquainted
example: I have trouble remembering the names of all my acquaintances
we are friends of the family

tr: an associate who provides cooperation or assistance
example: he's a good ally in fight

tr: a person you know well and regard with affection and trust
example: he was my best friend at the university

tr: a person who backs a politician or a team etc.
example: all their supporters came out for the game
they are friends of the library

example.tran: 我和我最好的朋友就此事进行了长谈。
example.ex: I had a long talk about this with my best friend...

example.tran: 她从来就不是我的密友。
example.ex: She never was a close friend of mine.

value.def: A friend is someone who you know well and like, but who is not related to you.

example.tran: 我还是想和艾莉森做朋友。
example.ex: I still wanted to be friends with Alison...

value.def: If you are friends with someone, you are their friend and they are yours.

example.tran: 伯明翰皇家芭蕾舞团赞助者协会

value.def: The friends of a country, cause, organization, or a famous politician are the people and organizations who help and support them.

example.tran: 总统说日本现在是盟友和国际合作伙伴。
example.ex: The president said that Japan is now a friend and international partner.

value.def: If one country refers to another as a friend, they mean that the other country is not an enemy of theirs.

example.tran: 他和流浪街头的孩子交上了朋友。
example.ex: He has made friends with the kids on the street...

example.tran: 丹尼斯很容易就能交到朋友。
他和两个女孩都成了朋友。
example.ex: He had made a friend of both girls.

value.def: If you make friends with someone, you begin a friendship with them. You can also say that two people make friends .

data.enText: person you like
a person you know well and like, and who is not usually a member of your family
This is my friend Tom.
Is he a friend of yours ?
She's an old friend (= I have known her a long time) .
He's one of my best friends .
data.chText: 他是我最要好的朋友之一。

data.enText: a close/good friend
a childhood/family/lifelong friend
data.chText: 儿时 / 家庭 / 终生朋友

data.enText: I heard about it through a friend of a friend .
data.chText: 我通过朋友的朋友听到这事的。

data.enText: She has a wide circle of friends .
supporter
a person who supports an organization, a charity, etc., especially by giving or raising money; a person who supports a particular idea, etc.
the Friends of St Martin's Hospital
a friend of democracy
not enemy
a person who has the same interests and opinions as yourself, and will help and support you
data.chText: 自己人；同志；同伙；同盟者

data.enText: You're among friends here─you can speak freely.
data.chText: 这儿都是自己人，有话直说好啦。

data.enText: silly/annoying person
used to talk about sb you do not know who has done sth silly or annoying
data.chText: （指做傻事或烦人的事而说话者不认识的人）

data.enText: I wish our friend at the next table would shut up.
data.chText: 但愿我们邻桌那位仁兄闭嘴。

data.enText: in parliament/court
used by a member of parliament to refer to another member of parliament or by a lawyer to refer to another lawyer in a court of law
data.chText: （议员间或律师间的一种称呼）朋友，阁下，同人

data.enText: my honourable friend , the member for Henley (= in the House of Commons)
data.chText: 我尊敬的朋友亨利区议员（下院用语）

data.enText: my noble friend (= in the House of Lords)
data.chText: 我尊贵的朋友（上院用语）

data.enText: my learned friend (= in a court of law)
data.chText: 我博学的同人（法庭用语）

data.enText: in religion
a member of the Society of Friends
be/make friends (with sb)
to be/become a friend of sb
data.chText: 是 / 成为（某人的）朋友

data.enText: We've been friends for years.
They had a quarrel, but they're friends again now.
data.chText: 他们吵过架，不过现在又和好了。

data.enText: Simon finds it hard to make friends with other children.
data.chText: 西蒙感到难以和其他孩子交朋友。

data.enText: be (just) good friends
used to say that two friends are not having a romantic relationship with each other
a friend in need (is a friend indeed)
a friend who gives you help when you need it (is a true friend)
data.chText: 患难的朋友（才是真正的朋友）；患难之交（见真情）

data.enText: have friends in high places
to know important people who can help you
data.chText: 有位高权重的朋友；有贵人相助

data.enText: man's best friend
a way of describing a dog
be/make friends (with sb)
to be/become a friend of sb
